meta.title: The Legacy of Timur
meta.description: The last great nomadic conqueror and his empire's alternative paths
meta.historical_context: Timur (Tamerlane) built the last great nomadic empire, conquering vast territories from India to Anatolia. His sudden death in 1405 during a campaign to China left questions about what could have been.
meta.divergence_point: The succession crisis and strategic decisions following Timur's death in 1405

emir_timur.name: Emir Timur (Tamerlane)
emir_timur.description: The last of the great nomadic conquerors. A military genius who sought to restore the Mongol Empire.

shahrukh.name: Shah Rukh
shahrukh.description: Timur's youngest son who turned the empire from a war machine into a center of art and science.

ulugh_beg.name: Ulugh Beg
ulugh_beg.description: A ruler who preferred stars to swords. Built one of the greatest observatories in history in Samarkand.

immortal-emir.title: The Immortal Emir: Conquest of China
immortal-emir.description: What if Timur survived his illness in 1405 and led his massive army into China?
immortal-emir.divergence_description: Timur recovers from his illness in Otrar and launches the invasion of Ming China.

survival_1405.title: The Miracle at Otrar
survival_1405.description: Timur recovers from his winter illness. The army marches East instead of dispersing.
survival_1405.impact: The campaign against China proceeds as planned.

fall_of_beijing_1407.title: The Fall of Beijing
fall_of_beijing_1407.description: Timurid forces, utilizing superior cavalry and gunpowder, breach the Great Wall and sack Beijing.
fall_of_beijing_1407.impact: End of the Ming Dynasty. Establishment of the Timurid Dynasty in China.

silk_road_monopoly_1410.title: The Silk Road Monopoly
silk_road_monopoly_1410.description: With control from Anatolia to the Pacific, Timur establishes absolute control over the Silk Road.
silk_road_monopoly_1410.impact: Europe is starved of trade, delaying the Renaissance. Central Asia becomes the world's economic hub.

consequences.short_term: Central Asia becomes the wealthiest region on Earth.
consequences.long_term: Global power center remains in Asia. European colonialism never starts.
consequences.global_impact: A completely different modern world dominated by Turko-Mongol culture.

immortal-emir.present_day_status: The Great Timurid Federation spans from Turkey to Korea. Samarkand is the world's capital of science and culture. Europe is a collection of backward feudal states. The primary global language is Chagatai Turkic.

unified-succession.title: The Pax Timuridea: A Stable Empire
unified-succession.description: What if Timur established a clear succession plan that prevented civil war?
unified-succession.divergence_description: Timur designates a clear heir and administrative structure before his death.

succession_plan_1404.title: The Grand Assembly
succession_plan_1404.description: Timur calls all his sons and grandsons to Samarkand, establishing clear succession rules.
succession_plan_1404.impact: Civil war is prevented through institutional reform.

shah_rukh_reforms_1410.title: The Administrative Revolution
shah_rukh_reforms_1410.description: Shah Rukh implements bureaucratic reforms modeled on Persian and Chinese systems.
shah_rukh_reforms_1410.impact: The empire transforms from tribal confederation to modern state.

ulugh_beg_renaissance_1425.title: The Samarkand Renaissance
ulugh_beg_renaissance_1425.description: Massive investment in science, art, and architecture makes Samarkand the intellectual capital of the world.
ulugh_beg_renaissance_1425.impact: Attracts scholars from Europe, China, and India. Scientific revolution begins in Central Asia.

consequences.short_term: Political stability allows cultural and economic flourishing.
consequences.long_term: The Timurid Empire becomes a lasting civilization rather than a fleeting conquest.
consequences.global_impact: Central Asia leads the Renaissance and Scientific Revolution.

unified-succession.present_day_status: The Timurid Commonwealth remains a major world power. Uzbekistan and surrounding regions lead in science and technology. Islam underwent an enlightenment similar to Europe's Renaissance.

empire-fragments.title: The Shattered Crown: Total Collapse
empire-fragments.description: What if the succession wars completely destroyed the Timurid legacy?
empire-fragments.divergence_description: All of Timur's sons and grandsons wage total war for succession.

civil_war_1405.title: The War of Six Princes
civil_war_1405.description: Timur's death triggers immediate warfare among all claimants to the throne.
civil_war_1405.impact: The empire fractures into warring kingdoms.

mongol_resurgence_1415.title: The Return of the Mongols
mongol_resurgence_1415.description: Weakened Timurid states fall to resurgent Mongol tribes from the steppes.
mongol_resurgence_1415.impact: Central Asia returns to tribal chaos and economic decline.

ottoman_dominance_1425.title: The Ottoman Opportunity
ottoman_dominance_1425.description: With Timurid collapse, the Ottomans rapidly expand eastward.
ottoman_dominance_1425.impact: The Ottoman Empire becomes even more powerful, dominating from Vienna to Persia.

consequences.short_term: Central Asia descends into centuries of warfare and poverty.
consequences.long_term: The region never recovers its former glory. Becomes a backwater.
consequences.global_impact: Ottoman and later Russian domination of Central Asia accelerates.

empire-fragments.present_day_status: Central Asia is even more fragmented and economically underdeveloped than in our timeline. The Timurid era is remembered only as a brief flash of greatness between Mongol and Russian empires.
